snippet: Hyde Park’s alcohol restrictions had long been in line with the teachings of the Mormon Church, but the town recently voted to allow sales.
abstract: Residents of Hyde Park, Utah, vote to allow alcohol sales, after long and bitter battle, making it one of the last bastions in the state to loosen rules on drinking; alcohol has had a quirky, complicated history in Utah, as lawmakers have had to consider the powerful influence of the Mormon Church, which frowns upon drinking.
lead_paragraph: Hyde Park’s alcohol restrictions had long been in line with the teachings of the Mormon Church, but the town recently voted to allow sales.

headline.main: Vote on Alcohol Sales Divides a Utah Town Where Few Drink
headline.print_headline: Vote on Alcohol Sales Divides a Utah Town Where Few Drink

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject
